text:
The NAEB will pay transportation to and from Allerton (air fare, railroad plus
pullman where needed, or six cents a mile for personal cars, but in no case
an amount exceeding air fare) and room and board while at Allerton. Meals
and lodging enroute, cabs, tips, and other miscellaneous expenses will NOT
be reimbursable. Each participant selected will pay his own travel and be
reimbursed after the seminar — no travel advances can be made by the NAEB.
Applications (for either or both of the above categories) should be submitted
in five copies and should specifically include the following information:
Institution and/or station represented; name and present and future responsi¬
bilities of nominee, plus ether pertinent information about nominee which
nominator feels will help the selection committee; specific recommendation
of superior indicating why this person was selected over other possible nomi¬
nees (if a nomination is made in the second category there must be letters of
recommendation - in five copies - both from the broadcast person making the
nomination and from the nominee’s dean or director in the college or school
of education.); a signed statement by the nominee that he will attend the full
session of the seminar and will submit a 500 word critique thereof at its
conclusion.
Applications should be mailed to Dr. Harry J. Skornia, Executive Director,
NAEB, 14 Gregory Hall, Urbana, Illinois, and must reach Headquarters not
later than June 1, 1958. Successful nominees will be notified by approxi¬
mately June 15, 1958 and will be sent additional information about the seminar
at that time.
